Generation II.Gold: By keeping still and listening intently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast-moving rivers.

(Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Azumarill 's long ears are indispensable sensors. By focusing its hearing, this Pok é mon can identify what kinds of prey are around, even in rough and fast-running rivers.
Generation III.Sapphire: Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pok é mon . The air balloons enable the Pok é mon in trouble to breathe.
Generation III.Emerald: It lives in water virtually all day long. Its body color and pattern act as camouflage that makes it tough for enemies to spot in water.
Generation III.FireRed: When it plays in water, it rolls up its elongated ears to prevent their insides from getting wet.
Generation III.LeafGreen: By keeping still and listening intently, it can even tell what is in wild, fast-moving rivers.

Generation IV.Diamond: It lives in rivers and lakes. In water, its coloring and patterns trick the vision of foes.
